workflow.name: Singapore university eligibility analyzer with GPT-4o-Mini, WordPress and Slack notifications
workflow.description:
## Introduction
Automates scholarship tracking by scraping university sites, assessing eligibility via AI, and publishing results to WordPress or Slack. Eliminates manual searches for students, counselors, and education platforms, enabling scalable curation and timely notifications.

## How it Works
Webhook triggers parallel scraping of NUS, NTU, SIT, SUTD ‚Üí merge data ‚Üí AI evaluates eligibility ‚Üí aggregate qualified scholarships ‚Üí generate summaries ‚Üí post to WordPress/Slack ‚Üí send email notifications with appeal options.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure OpenAI credentials and eligibility prompt template
2. Update HTTP requests with university URLs and selectors
3. Add WordPress site URL and API credentials
4. Create Slack webhook and notification channel
5. Configure Gmail/SMTP for email notifications

## Workflow
Webhook ‚Üí Scrape 4 Universities (Parallel) ‚Üí Merge Data ‚Üí Prepare Context ‚Üí AI Eligibility Check ‚Üí Aggregate Results ‚Üí Generate Summary ‚Üí Check Status ‚Üí Publish Slack/Email/WordPress ‚Üí Handle Appeals

## Workflow Steps
1. Scraping: Fetch scholarship pages from four universities simultaneously
2. Merge: Combine data into a unified dataset
3. AI Processing: Analyze eligibility criteria, deadlines against student profile
4. Aggregation: Consolidate qualified scholarships with match scores
5. Publishing: Post to WordPress, send Slack/email with results
6. Appeals: Webhook handles rejection appeals with AI review

## Prerequisites
OpenAI API key, WordPress site with REST API, Slack workspace with webhook, Gmail/SMTP credentials, student profile data (GPA, citizenship, major)

## Use Cases
Counselors automating recommendations for 100+ students, financial aid offices aggregating departmental opportunities

## Customization
Add universities (SMU, SUSS, international institutions), include government schemes (MOE, Edusave, Mendaki)

## Benefits
Saves 10+ hours weekly per counselor, monitors 50+ scholarships automatically, provides AI eligibility matching (85%+ accuracy)

workflow.name: GPT-4o-Mini-Powered University Admission Finder with Eligibility Matching

parameters.text:
=You are an expert university admissions advisor for Singapore universities.

Analyze the following admission requirements from {{ $json.university }} engineering programs:

{{ $json.htmlContent }}

User Profile:
- Academic Grades: {{ $json.userGrades }}
- Subjects Taken: {{ $json.userSubjects }}
- Qualifications: {{ $json.userQualifications }}

Your task:
1. Extract the key admission requirements for engineering programs (minimum grades, required subjects, qualifications)
2. Compare the user's profile against these requirements
3. Determine eligibility status: ELIGIBLE, NOT ELIGIBLE, or BORDERLINE
4. Provide specific reasoning for your determination

Return your analysis in this JSON format:
{
  "university": "{{ $json.university }}",
  "eligibilityStatus": "ELIGIBLE/NOT ELIGIBLE/BORDERLINE",
  "minimumRequirements": "extracted requirements",
  "userMeetsRequirements": true/false,
  "reasoning": "detailed explanation",
  "recommendations": "advice for the applicant"
}

options.systemMessage: You are a precise university admissions analyzer. Always return valid JSON output and be thorough in your eligibility assessment.

parameters.responseBody: ={{ { success: true, eligibilityReport: $('Generate Summary').item.json, message: 'Analysis complete. Check detailed results.' } }}

parameters.text:
=You are an expert admissions appeal letter writer for Singapore universities.

User Profile:
- Academic Grades: {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.grades }}
- Subjects Taken: {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.subjects }}
- Qualifications: {{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.qualifications }}

Eligibility Analysis:
{{ JSON.stringify($('Generate Summary').item.json.detailedAnalysis) }}

Your task:
1. Craft a professional, compelling appeal letter for each university where the user was deemed NOT ELIGIBLE or BORDERLINE
2. Highlight the user's strengths and potential
3. Address any weaknesses with constructive framing
4. Demonstrate genuine interest in the engineering program
5. Request reconsideration of the admission decision

For each university, generate:
- A personalized subject line
- A complete appeal letter (300-500 words)
- Key points to emphasize
- Supporting documents to attach (recommendations)

Return your output as a JSON array:
[
  {
    "university": "University Name",
    "subject": "Appeal for Reconsideration - Engineering Program Application",
    "letterBody": "Full letter text...",
    "keyStrengths": ["strength 1", "strength 2"],
    "recommendedAttachments": ["document 1", "document 2"]
  }
]

options.systemMessage: You are a professional admissions consultant. Write persuasive, authentic appeal letters that maintain appropriate tone and respect while advocating strongly for the applicant.

parameters.text:
=üìß *Appeal Letters Generated*

*Applicant:* {{ $('Format Appeal Emails').first().json.applicantName }}
*Universities:* {{ $('Format Appeal Emails').all().map(i => i.json.university).join(', ') }}

*Action Required:*
‚úÖ Review appeal letters in WordPress (drafts)
‚úÖ User should attach supporting documents
‚úÖ Send appeals before deadline

_Appeals are ready for review and sending._

parameters.responseBody: ={{ { success: true, message: 'Appeal letters generated successfully', appeals: $('Format Appeal Emails').all().map(i => ({ university: i.json.university, subject: i.json.subject, to: i.json.to })), nextSteps: ['Review the appeal letters', 'Attach supporting documents (transcripts, recommendation letters)', 'Send appeals to universities', 'Follow up after 2-3 weeks'] } }}
={{ { success: true, message: 'Congratulations! You are eligible for universities. No appeals needed.', eligibleUniversities: $('Generate Summary').item.json.eligibleUniversities } }}

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
